name: Locky Ransomware Encrypted File
summary: An ODIN file is a file encrypted by the Locky virus, a trojan horse created by cybercriminals that target Windows users. It contains a user's file, such as a .WMV or .PDF file, encrypted with RSA algorithm and AES-256 encryption. ODIN files became prevalent in 2016 and are similar to .LOCKY files.

open.note: Open with an associated app listed below.
